text: Luther Burbank (March 7, 1849 â€“ April 11, 1926) was an American botanist, horticulturist and pioneer in agricultural science. He developed more than 800 strains and varieties of plants over his 55-year career. Burbank's varied creations included fruits, flowers, grains, grasses, and vegetables. He developed (but did not create) a spineless cactus (useful for cattle-feed) and the plumcot. ==References== Category:1849 births Category:1926 deaths Category:American botanists
title: Luther Burbank
